package.name: flexible_navigation
package.description:
Flexible Navigation is a rework of the ROS Navigation stack into independent modules that interface with FlexBE (http://wiki.ros.org/flexbe) compatible state implementations.
These allow a user to graphically chain together states in a state machine to essentially create their own navigation stack to suit any need.
This allows for supervisory and sliding autonomy within navigation, and better control over contingencies and recovery behaviors.
The flex_nav package is largely based on navigation2 meaning that, flex_nav supports the same features, but implements them differently.
